etymologies: early 17th century (in the Latin form): from Latin basaltes (variant of basanites), from Greek basanitēs, from basanos ‘touchstone’

definitions: a dark, fine-grained volcanic rock that sometimes displays a columnar structure. It is typically composed largely of plagioclase with pyroxene and olivine.
shortDefinitions: dark fine-grained volcanic rock that sometimes displays columnar structure

definitions: a kind of black stoneware resembling basalt.
shortDefinitions: kind of black stoneware developed by Josiah Wedgwood
